The firm was licensed by the Securities and Exchange Commission on November 20, 2014 as Issuing House and Underwriters.

The Firm commenced operations at a very significant point in the evolution of the Nigerian financial services industry and will leverage it&rsquo;s solid capital base, the strong financial services background of its promoters and the excellent track-record and credentials of its directors and shareholders.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position:&nbsp;Relationship Officer

Job Location:&nbsp;Lagos
Job Type: Full Time&nbsp;

Job Summary&nbsp;


	First Ally Trust Microfinance Bank&#39;s Relationship Officer is responsible for prospecting, marketing, business development, and income generation in line with the key performance indicators.
	The marketer is the interface between the bank and the customer and nurtures mutually beneficial relationships between both parties.


Responsibilities&nbsp;


	Achieve growth within the key performance indicators: liability and risk asset generation, account opening, income generation, and e-banking product offerings.&nbsp;
	Evaluate the creditworthiness of customers by processing loan applications and documentation.&nbsp;
	Monitors active loans and enforces collection and recoveries.&nbsp;
	Ensures the achievement of all budget parameters.&nbsp;
	Develop referral networks and cross-sell products and services.&nbsp;
	Ensures a high level of customer satisfaction through excellent customer engagement and service delivery.&nbsp;
	Actively seek out new sales opportunities through cold calling, networking, and referrals.&nbsp;
	Expedites the resolution of complaints to maximise satisfaction and boost customer service experience.&nbsp;
	Achieve a healthy portfolio and deposit mix.&nbsp;
	Executes marketing strategy and develops marketing campaigns.&nbsp;
	Ensures compliance with all internal policies and regulatory guidelines.&nbsp;
	Monitors competition by gathering current marketplace information on pricing, products, etc.&nbsp;
	Recommends changes in products, services, and policy by evaluating results and competitive developments.&nbsp;
	Identify potential loan markets and develop referral networks.&nbsp;
	Perform any other duties as may be assigned by management.&nbsp;

	Certificate of completion/exemption from NYSC&nbsp;

	Basic understanding of sales principles and customer service practices.&nbsp;
	Friendly, helpful, confident, and engaging personality.&nbsp;
	Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.&nbsp;
	Ability to work in a goal-oriented environment.&nbsp;
	Ability to work in a team.&nbsp;
	Strong planning, organizational, and time management abilities.&nbsp;
	Proficient in the use of MS Office suite.

Relationship Officer Job at First Ally Capital




        
    

        
        First Ally Capital is a wholly indigenous Financial Services firm, whose focus is on providing top notch advisory & investment services to individuals and organizations. First Ally Capital was incorporated on May 20, 2014 as an Issuing House, Financial Advisory and Investment Management firm, with authorized capital of N2.5 billion, and an issued and fully-paid capital of N1.65 billion. The firm was licensed by the Securities and Exchange Commission on November 20, 2014 as Issuing House and Underwriters.
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    



The Firm commenced operations at a very significant point in the evolution of the Nigerian financial services industry and will leverage it’s solid capital base, the strong financial services background of its promoters and the excellent track-record and credentials of its directors and shareholders.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Relationship Officer

Job Location: Lagos
Job Type: Full Time 

Job Summary 


	First Ally Trust Microfinance Bank's Relationship Officer is responsible for prospecting, marketing, business development, and income generation in line with the key performance indicators.
	The marketer is the interface between the bank and the customer and nurtures mutually beneficial relationships between both parties.


Responsibilities 


	Achieve growth within the key performance indicators: liability and risk asset generation, account opening, income generation, and e-banking product offerings. 
	Evaluate the creditworthiness of customers by processing loan applications and documentation. 
	Monitors active loans and enforces collection and recoveries. 
	Ensures the achievement of all budget parameters. 
	Develop referral networks and cross-sell products and services. 
	Ensures a high level of customer satisfaction through excellent customer engagement and service delivery. 
	Actively seek out new sales opportunities through cold calling, networking, and referrals. 
	Expedites the resolution of complaints to maximise satisfaction and boost customer service experience. 
	Achieve a healthy portfolio and deposit mix. 
	Executes marketing strategy and develops marketing campaigns. 
	Ensures compliance with all internal policies and regulatory guidelines. 
	Monitors competition by gathering current marketplace information on pricing, products, etc. 
	Recommends changes in products, services, and policy by evaluating results and competitive developments. 
	Identify potential loan markets and develop referral networks. 
	Perform any other duties as may be assigned by management. 


Requirements and Qualifications


	OND / HND / BSc in Social Science or any other related course.
	Certificate of completion/exemption from NYSC 
	Previous experience in a marketing role is an advantage. 
	Demonstrated ability to communicate, present, and influence credibly and effectively at all societal levels. 
	Proven ability to drive the sales process. 
	Strong business sense and industry expertise. 
	Basic understanding of sales principles and customer service practices. 
	Friendly, helpful, confident, and engaging personality. 
	Excellent communication and interpersonal skills. 
	Ability to work in a goal-oriented environment. 
	Ability to work in a team. 
	Strong planning, organizational, and time management abilities. 
	Proficient in the use of MS Office suite.

Field Marketer Job at QEFAS




        
    

        
        QEFAS is an international educational company that seeks to use technology to provide smart learning and advanced educational solutions to developing countries. Our goal is to bridge the educational gap between these countries and the developed nations by the utilization of artificial intelligence and software to drive cultural change and foster partnerships that will ultimately improve social-economic status of the societies where we operate.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Field Marketer

Job Location: Ikeja, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time (Field / Hybrid)

About the Role
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	We are seeking energetic, target-driven, and self-motivated Field Marketers to join QEFAS and help expand our digital learning solutions across Nigeria.
	If you enjoy meeting new people, closing deals, and building strong client relationships while growing your income, this role is perfect for you.


Key Responsibilities


	Conduct direct field sales and customer acquisition within assigned territories.
	Promote QEFAS E-Learning solutions, including Self-Paced Courses, In-Person Trainings, and Virtual Learning programs.
	Identify prospective clients, pitch products, conduct demonstrations (where applicable), and close sales.
	Achieve weekly and monthly sales targets.
	Maintain accurate records of leads, conversions, and customer interactions using the CRM system.
	Build and sustain strong relationships with clients, and business partners.
	Support marketing campaigns and uphold company policies, ethics, and brand standards in the field.
	Provide market feedback on client needs, competitor offerings, and opportunities for business growth.


Requirements


	HND or Bachelor’s Degree in Business, Marketing, Social Sciences, or related fields.
	Minimum of 1 year of experience in field sales, direct marketing, EdTech sales, FinTech, Telecom, or FMCG.
	Strong communication, persuasion, and negotiation skills.
	Ability to work independently and navigate assigned locations confidently.
	Proficiency in spoken and written English.
	Fresh graduates with strong interest in sales are encouraged to apply.


Compensation & Benefits


	N100,000 monthly
	Attractive performance-based incentives (commission on sales)
	Training on QEFAS products and sales processes
	Opportunities for career growth into Senior Sales, or Team Lead.


Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV and a brief cover letter to: qefasrecruitment@gmail.com using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.

Employment Type: Full-time

About the Role


	We are seeking a dedicated and experienced Safety Officer to join our team.

Responsibilities


	Implement and monitor HSE policies, procedures, and guidelines on all project sites.

	Maintain proper documentation of HSE activities and ensure readiness for internal and external audits.
	Collaborate with project managers and site supervisors to improve safety performance.


Requirements


	Interested candidates should possess an HND qualification.
	Minimum of 5 years of experience in a safety role especially in construction / real estate companies.
	HSE certification ( HSE level 1,2,3 or its equivalent)
	Strong knowledge of safety standards and regulations.


Salary
N250,000 - N300,000 monthly.&nbsp;

Application Closing Date:&nbsp;25th December, 2025.

Starting Date &amp; Venue of Physical Interview
Thursday, 11th and Friday, 12th December, 2025.
Prestigious Homes Limited,
Lagoon District, End of Freedom way,
Lekki Phase 1, Lagos State.

Method of Application&nbsp;
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to:&nbsp;hr@prestigioushomeslimited.com&nbsp;and copy (cc):&nbsp;chisom.onwudinjo@prestigioushomeslimited.com&nbsp;using &quot;Health and Safety Manager&quot; as the subject of the mail.

Note: For more enquires, please call: 07074863616.

&nbsp;

&nbsp;

2.)&nbsp;Procurement Manager

Job Location:&nbsp;Lekki,&nbsp;Lagos&nbsp;
Employment Type: Full Time (On site)

Required Qualifications


	Bachelor&rsquo;s Degree in related field.
	At least 6 years of professional experience in procurement, preferably within luxury real estate,property management or constructions.
	Strong negotiation skills with a proven track record of managing vendor relationships and sourcing high-quality construction materials.
	Experience in vendor evaluation, contract management, and cost optimization.
	Solid understanding of procurement processes, supply chain logistics, and market trends in the real estate sector.
	Excellent communication, organizational, and analytical skills.
	Ability to work independently and lead procurement activities for premium luxury properties.
	Familiarity with Lagos markets and supplier landscape is an advantage.


Salary
N300,000 - N400,000 / month.

Application Closing Date:&nbsp;19th December, 2025.

Starting Date &amp; Venue of Physical Interview
Thursday, 11th and Friday, 12th December, 2025.
Prestigious Homes Limited,
Lagoon District, End of Freedom way,
Lekki Phase 1, Lagos State.

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to:&nbsp;hr@prestigioushomeslimited.com&nbsp;and copy (cc):&nbsp;chisom.onwudinjo@prestigioushomeslimited.com&nbsp;using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.

Note:&nbsp;For more enquires, please call: 07074863616.

&nbsp;

&nbsp;

3.)&nbsp;Spy Driver (Supernumerary Police)

Job Location:&nbsp;Ikate - Lekki Phase 1, Lagos

Job Description


	We are seeking a Spy Driver (Supernumerary Police) to work closely with our top management team.
	This role involves providing secure, discreet transportation, and operational support with a strong focus on safety and confidentiality.
	The ideal candidate must be smart, highly experienced, and fluent in English.


Key Responsibilities


	Provide secure and discreet driving services.
	Operate primarily within and around the Lagos Island axis with expert knowledge of the area.
	Assist in surveillance and security operations as required.
	Maintain high standards of confidentiality and professionalism.
	Communicate effectively.
	Ensure the vehicle is maintained in excellent condition and ready at all times.


Requirements


	Minimum of 7 years of driving experience, preferably with supervisory or police driving background.
	Must be a Supernumerary Police personnel with relevant identification/documentation.
	Good communication skills.
	Deep familiarity with Lagosroute and traffic patterns.
	Smart, vigilant, and able to work independently.
	Valid driver&rsquo;s license with an excellent driving record.
	High integrity, trustworthy, and discreet in handling confidential information.


Benefits


	Salary: N200,000 Monthly.
	Accommodation will be discussed.


Application Closing Date:&nbsp;10th, December 2025.

Physical Interviews:
Thursday 11th and Friday 12th, December 2025.

Method of Application&nbsp;
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV, picture photograph, valid driver&#39;s license and SPY certificates to:&nbsp;hr@prestigioushomeslimited.com&nbsp;and copy (cc)&nbsp;chisom.onwudinjo@prestigioushomeslimited.com&nbsp;using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.

Note


	The role requires a one weekend on and one weekend off.
	Only serious candidates will be considered.
	For more enquiries, please call: 07074863616.

Facility Manager Job at Prestigious Homes Limited




        
    

        
        Prestigious Homes Limited is a luxury home builder, delivering homes to their owners just the way they envisioned it.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Facility Manager

Job Location: Lekki and Environs - Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Required Qualifications
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	Minimum of Higher National Diploma (HND) in Property Management, Building Technology, Facility Management, or related field.
	At least 4 years of professional experience managingresidential properties.
	Strong knowledge of facility operations, maintenance procedures, and health & safety regulations in luxury residential settings.
	Proven ability to coordinate contractors, vendors, and service providers efficiently.
	Experience managing budgets, procurement, and preventive maintenance programs.
	Excellent organizational, leadership, and communication skills.
	Customer-focused with a proactive approach to problem-solving.
	Familiarity with Lekkiand its environs is an advantage.


Salary Range
N200,000 - N250,000 / month (Based on experience).

Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: hr@prestigioushomeslimited.com and copy (cc): chisom.onwudinjo@prestigioushomeslimited.com using the Job Position as subject of the mail.

Interview Details


	Physical interview will be holding Thursday 11th and Friday 12th December 2025.
	Address: Prestigious Homes Limited, Lagoon District, End of Freedom way, Lekki Phase 1.


Note: For more enquires, please call: 07074863616.
